LanguageData.SmokeleafAddiction.label: cannabis addiction
LanguageData.SmokeleafAddiction.description: A chemical addiction to cannabis. Long-term use of cannabis has caused neurological adaptations at the cellular level, so the brain can no longer function properly without the drug. \nWithout regular doses of cannabis, withdrawal symptoms will begin. However, extended abstinence will force the brain to adapt back to its normal state, resolving the addiction.
LanguageData.SmokeleafHigh.label: high on cannabis
LanguageData.SmokeleafHigh.description: Cannabis' active chemical in the bloodstream. Generates a soft feeling of fuzzy well-being.
LanguageData.SmokeleafTolerance.label: cannabis tolerance
LanguageData.SmokeleafTolerance.description: A built-up tolerance to cannabis. The more severe this tolerance is, the more cannabis it takes to get the same effect.
